def postAsEvent()

Description¶

Utility functions relating to Qt events.

class msTools.coreUI.qt.event_utils.EventPriority¶

Bases: object

A namespace for custom Qt event priority constants.

IDLE = -2¶

Less important than status events. Executes after idle events have processed.

Access:R
Type:int
LOW = -1¶

A status event.

Access:R
Type:int
NORMAL = 0¶

A normal event.

Access:R
Type:int
IMPORTANT = 1¶

An important event.

Access:R
Type:int
VERY_IMPORTANT = 2¶

A more important event.

Access:R
Type:int
CRITICAL = 200¶

A critical event.

Access:R
Type:int
msTools.coreUI.qt.event_utils.postAsEvent(callable_, *args, **kwargs)¶

Post a callable on the Qt event queue via PySide2.QtCore.QCoreApplication.postEvent().

Parameters:
  • callable_ (callable [[*args, **kwargs], any]) – The callable to post. Must be compatible with *args and **kwargs.
  • *args – Sequence of positional arguments for callable_.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments for callable_.
Other Parameters:
 

priority (int, optional) – The priority used to post callable_ on the event queue. Defaults to EventPriority.NORMAL.

Example

# Executes `foo` after idle events have processed
postAsEvent(foo, priority=EventPriority.IDLE)
class msTools.coreUI.qt.event_utils.SignalEventFilter(eventType, parent=None)¶

Bases: PySide2.QtCore.QObject

An event filter that will listen for a specific PySide2.QtCore.QEvent.Type, emitting a signal when it occurs.

eventTriggered = <PySide2.QtCore.Signal object>¶
__init__(eventType, parent=None)¶

Initialize the event filter.

Parameters:
  • eventType (PySide2.QtCore.QEvent.Type) – The event type to listen for.
  • parent (PySide2.QtCore.QObject, optional) – Parent object for the event filter. Defaults to None.
eventType¶

The event type to listen for.

Access:RW
Type:PySide2.QtCore.QEvent.Type
